USBDevice.summary: NOTE Experimental The USBDevice interface of the WebUSB API provides access to metadata about a paired USB device and methods for controlling it.

USBDeviceDeviceClass.summary:
NOTE Experimental The deviceClass read only property of the
interface one of three properties that identify USB devices for
the purpose of loading a USB driver that will work with that device. The other two
properties are USBDevice.deviceSubclass and USBDevice.deviceProtocol.

USBDeviceSelectAlternateInterface.summary:
NOTE Experimental The selectAlternateInterface() method of the
interface returns a {{jsxref("promise")}} that resolves when
the specified alternative endpoint is selected.

USBDeviceProductId.summary:
NOTE Experimental The productId read only property of the
interface the manufacturer-defined code that identifies a USB
device.
USBDeviceProductId.value: The manufacturer-defined code that identifies a USB device.

USBDeviceForget.summary: NOTE Experimental The forget() method of the interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves when all pending operations are aborted, all open interfaces are released, the device session has ended, and the permission is reset.
USBDeviceForget.returns: A which resolves with undefined once the device access permission is revoked.

USBDeviceSelectConfiguration.summary:
NOTE Experimental The selectConfiguration() method of the
interface returns a {{jsxref("promise")}} that resolves when
the specified configuration is selected.

USBDeviceTransferIn.summary:
NOTE Experimental The transferIn() method of the
interface returns a that resolves with a
when bulk or interrupt data is received from the USB
device.

USBDeviceSerialNumber.summary:
NOTE Experimental The serialNumber read only property of the
interface is the manufacturer-defined serial number for the
specific USB device.
USBDeviceSerialNumber.value: The serial number for the specified USB device

USBDeviceDeviceVersionMajor.summary:
NOTE Experimental The deviceVersionMajor read only property of the
interface he major version number of the device in a semantic
versioning scheme.

USBDeviceManufacturerName.summary:
NOTE Experimental The manufacturerName read only property of the
interface the of the organization that manufactured the USB
device.

USBDeviceVendorId.summary:
NOTE Experimental The vendorId read only property of the
interface is the official usb.org-assigned vendor ID.

USBDeviceIsochronousTransferIn.summary: NOTE Experimental The isochronousTransferIn() method of the interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with a when time sensitive information has been transmitted to (received by) the USB device.

USBDeviceControlTransferIn.summary: NOTE Experimental The controlTransferIn() method of the interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with a when a command or status request has been transmitted to (received by) the USB device.

USBDeviceOpened.summary:
NOTE Experimental The opened read only property of the
interface indicates whether a session has been started with a
paired USB device. A device must be opened before it can be controlled by a web page.

USBDeviceTransferOut.summary:
NOTE Experimental The transferOut() method of the
interface returns a that resolves with a
when bulk or interrupt data is sent to the USB
device.

USBDeviceControlTransferOut.summary: NOTE Experimental The controlTransferOut() method of the interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with a when a command or status operation has been transmitted from the USB device.

USBDeviceReleaseInterface.summary:
NOTE Experimental The releaseInterface() method of the
interface returns a {{jsxref("promise")}} that resolves when a
claimed interface is released from exclusive access.

USBDeviceUsbVersionSubminor.summary:
NOTE Experimental The usbVersionSubminor read only property of the
interface is one of three properties that declare the USB
protocol version supported by the device. The other two properties
are USBDevice.usbVersionMajor and USBDevice.usbVersionMinor.
USBDeviceUsbVersionSubminor.value:
The first of three properties that declare the USB protocol version supported by the
device.

USBDeviceUsbVersionMajor.summary:
NOTE Experimental The usbVersionMajor read only property of the
interface is one of three properties that declare the USB
protocol version supported by the device. The other two properties
are USBDevice.usbVersionMinor and USBDevice.usbVersionSubminor.
USBDeviceUsbVersionMajor.value:
The last of three properties that declare the USB protocol version supported by the
device.

USBDeviceDeviceVersionSubminor.summary:
NOTE Experimental The deviceVersionSubminor read only property of the
interface the patch version number of the device in a semantic
versioning scheme.

USBDeviceDeviceSubclass.summary:
NOTE Experimental The deviceSubclass read only property of the
interface one of three properties that identify USB devices for
the purpose of loading a USB driver that will work with that device. The other two
properties are USBDevice.deviceClass and USBDevice.deviceProtocol.

USBDeviceClaimInterface.summary:
NOTE Experimental The claimInterface() method of the
interface returns a {{jsxref("promise")}} that resolves when
the requested interface is claimed for exclusive access.

USBDeviceConfiguration.summary:
NOTE Experimental The configuration read only property of the
interface returns a object for
the currently selected interface for a paired USB device.

USBDeviceConfigurations.summary:
NOTE Experimental The configurations read only property of the
interface an {{jsxref("array")}} of device-specific interfaces
for controlling a paired USB device.

USBDeviceProductName.summary:
NOTE Experimental The productName read only property of the
interface the manufacturer-defined name that identifies a USB
device.
USBDeviceProductName.value: The manufacturer-defined name that identifies a USB device.

USBDeviceClearHalt.summary:
NOTE Experimental The clearHalt() method of the
interface returns a that resolves when a halt condition is
cleared. A halt condition is when a data transfer to or from the device has a status
of 'stall', which requires the web page (the host system, in USB
terminology) to clear that condition. See the for details.

USBDeviceIsochronousTransferOut.summary:
NOTE Experimental The isochronousTransferOut() method of the
interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with a when time sensitive information has been transmitted from the USB device.

USBDeviceOpen.summary:
NOTE Experimental The open() method of the
interface returns a that resolves when a device session has
started.

USBDeviceUsbVersionMinor.summary:
NOTE Experimental The usbVersionMinor read only property of the
interface is one of three properties that declare the USB
protocol version supported by the device. The other two properties
are USBDevice.usbVersionMajor and USBDevice.usbVersionSubminor.
USBDeviceUsbVersionMinor.value:
The second of three properties that declare the USB protocol version supported by the
device.

USBDeviceClose.summary:
NOTE Experimental The close() method of the
interface returns a that resolves when all open interfaces are
released and the device session has ended.

USBDeviceDeviceProtocol.summary:
NOTE Experimental The deviceProtocol read only property of the
interface one of three properties that identify USB devices for
the purpose of loading a USB driver that will work with that device. The other two
properties are USBDevice.deviceClass
and USBDevice.deviceSubclass.

USBDeviceReset.summary:
NOTE Experimental The reset() method of the
interface returns a that resolves when the device is reset and all
app operations canceled and their promises rejected.

USBDeviceDeviceVersionMinor.summary:
NOTE Experimental The deviceVersionMinor read only property of the
interface the minor version number of the device in a semantic
versioning scheme.
